mads.note: Brill's New Pauly: "Pacianus, After AD 343, bishop of Barcinona (modern Barcelona), died before 393; of his life practically nothing is known. Three letters from him to the Novatian Sympronianus survive, in which he opposes Novatianism (Novatianus) (CPL 561), also a pamphlet Paraenesis sive Exhortatorius Libellus ad Paenitentiam (Exhortation to Penitence, CPL 562) and a Sermo de Baptismo (Sermon on Baptism, CPL 563)...." Markschies, Christoph (Berlin), “Pacianus”, in: Brill’s New Pauly, Antiquity volumes edited by: Hubert Cancik and , Helmuth Schneider. Consulted online on 08 November 2016
